hadiths.english_translation: From Anas: We were commanded not to exceed People of the Book [in wages] and commanded [not] to do harm. This is reported via Waqi' from Ibn Aun. And Muhammad said: Narrated to us Azhar from Ibn Aun from Humaid ibn Zadhawih from Anas likewise, or we were prohibited from conducting a transaction between a resident and a Bedouin.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

hadiths.english_translation: The father of Abu al-Tiyah al-Basri. Abu al-Tiyah Yazid ibn al-Hamid narrated from him. Al-Hasan ibn Abd al-Aziz said: Narrated to us Ayyub ibn Suwayd from Ibn Shuddhab from Yazid ibn Hamid: My father died during the Jaraf [plague], meaning the plague of Basra. Abu Abdullah said: As for Ayyub, he is not strong.

chainIssues: Ayyub ibn Suwayd is classified as Da'if (weak), which directly weakens the reliability of the transmission; the original unnamed narrator is also not identified

potential_issues.issue: Ayyub ibn Suwayd is classified as a weak narrator by hadith scholars
potential_issues.impact: The presence of a weak narrator in the chain makes this hadith weak according to hadith principles. Abu Abdullah (likely Al-Bukhari) explicitly criticized Ayyub's reliability

potential_issues.issue: The primary narrator of the account (Abu al-Tiyah's father) is not explicitly named in the initial part of the biographical entry
potential_issues.impact: The entry is primarily biographical commentary rather than a complete hadith with a clear matn

hadiths.english_translation: Heard Ibn Umar. Al-Walid ibn Sulayman ibn Abi al-Sa'ib narrated from him, and also Yahya al-Sibani. And he narrates from Ibrahim - he is al-Asfar - and Abd al-Aziz brother of Hudhayfah. And Abu al-Mughirah narrated from Abu Bakr ibn Abi Maryam from Humaid ibn Uqbah ibn Ruman from Abu al-Darda from the Prophet ﷺ: Whoever is written for him a good deed, he enters Paradise. And Ibn Ishaq narrated from Humaid ibn Roman ibn Zararah. Ahmad said: Narrated to us Abu al-Mughirah. I asked Abu Bakr and said: Humaid ibn Uqbah, I see him as old, and you narrate from him from Abu al-Darda. He said: He informed me that every hadith he narrated to me from Abu al-Darda, he heard it from Abu al-Darda.

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Hasan ibn Waqi' said: Narrated to us Dhamrah from Raja ibn Abi Salamah from Abdullah ibn Abi Nu'aym from Ibn Muhayriz: Umar ibn al-Khattab was invited to a banquet, then he said: I wish I had not attended it, because I see that its owner only prepared it out of ostentation. And Muhammad ibn Muqatil said: Abdullah told me, he said: We were narrated by Hammad ibn Salamah from Raja Abu al-Muqdam from Ahl al-Ramlah from Nuaym ibn Abdullah, the scribe of Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz, that Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz said: The abundance of speech prevents me from fear of boasting.

chainIssues: Abdullah ibn Abi Nu'aym is classified as Da'if (weak), which directly compromises the reliability of the first chain

Abu Abdullah said: I think he is from his mother's side.
